contentBlocks.content: Chinese is a family of related languages or dialects that originated in China. There are hundreds, and some argue, thousands, of different dialects of Chinese. The most important one you should know is Mandarin

Mandarin, with about 900,000,000 speakers, is the official language of China, Taiwan, an official language of Singapore, and one of six official languages of the united Nations. When people refer to the “Chinese” language, they are usually referring to Mandarin.

• the official/main language of China and Taiwan
• one of the four official languages of Singapore
• spoken in Malaysia, Indonesia, Vietnam, Hong Kong, South Africa, Macau, Cambodia, Thailand, Philippines, UK, USA, and Brunei, among others

Pinyin is a romanization system. A romanization system allows us to change writing from a script, such as Chinese or Russian, into the Latin (Roman) script which uses the ABC alphabet that you already know.
Chinese has several romanization systems, but in this course we are going to stick to just one - Pinyin! We use Pinyin to convert characters into words we can read and pronounce more easily.
Pinyin is a phonetic system and is formally called Hanyu Pinyin. Hanyu means the language of the Han people - China’s largest ethnic group.
A Pinyin syllable consists of 3 components - Initials, Finals, and Tones.
epresent consonant sounds in Pinyin.
Represent vowel sounds in Pinyin.

There are four tones in total.
Remember : Tones are always placed on top of the initials!

Click next to proceed to the Final Assessment of Module 0

You cannot return to the module pages until you finish this exam.

conceptual.questionText: True or False: When people refer to the 'Chinese' language, they are usually referring to Mandarin.

True or False: Tones are placed on top of the finals.
True or False: Initials are vowels.
True or False: A romanization system allows us to change writing from a script, such as Chinese or Russian, into the Latin (Roman) script.
True or False: Chinese has several romanization systems.
True or False: Hanyu means the language of the Yu people - China’s largest ethnic group.
Pinyin is formally called ______ Pinyin.
A Pinyin syllable consists of ___ components.
Pinyin is a __________.

contentBlocks.content: In a Pinyin syllable, an initial is the consonant. Initials are always before the final, hence its name. There are 21 Pinyin initials in total.
By definition, aspiration is a strong puff of air. There are 6 aspirated initials in Mandarin.
Click on the buttons to hear how the following initials are pronounced. Can you hear a difference?

contentBlocks.content: In a Pinyin syllable, finals represent vowel sounds. Finals always come after initials. This course will tackle 35 Pinyin finals, separated into five sets.
Click the buttons to hear how each final is pronounced

The basic unit of the Chinese language is a syllable, with three components; initials (consonants), finals (vowels), and tones.

• Tones are placed on top of finals
• A change in tone gives a different meaning to the word

Mandarin is a tonal language. Tones are an essential part of proper pronunciation, as many characters in Mandarin have the same sound. Therefore, tones are necessary when speaking Chinese in order to differentiate words from each other.

contentBlocks.header: Pinyin tones are very much like the English intonation and voice inflection.
contentBlocks.content: A difference in tone or voice inflection in English would give a different meaning, this then is similar to Mandarin Chinese.
An example in English is: “Yes?” and “Yes!

• High and flat tone
• Similar pitch as /may/ in the English word “maybe”
Click the buttons to hear how each syllable in the first tone is pronounced

• Rising tone
• Similar intonation as interrogative sentences in English
• Similar pitch as the English sentence “What?”
Click the buttons to hear how each syllable in the second tone is pronounced

• Falling-rising tone
• From mid-low to low and rises to mid-high pitch
• In this course, the final “ü” is pronounced in the third tone
Click the buttons to hear how each syllable in the third tone is pronounced

• Falling tone
• Similar intonation as an emphatic statement in English
• Similar pitch as the English sentence “No!”
Click the buttons to hear how each syllable in the fourth tone is pronounced
